name: Jay Shah
description: Software engineering student at King's College London with experience in full-stack development, data analysis, and machine learning.

projects.heading: Financial Dashboard with Stock Predictor
projects.description: Developed an LSTM model in TensorFlow to forecast stock prices. Built a sentiment analysis tool for evaluating investor sentiment based on news and social media. Designed a UI with JavaScript and a backend in Python using Flask.

projects.heading: Recipe Tracker / Meal Planner
projects.description: Developed a full-stack meal planning application with CRUD functionality using React and Node.js. Implemented a 30-day meal planning feature with automated shopping list emails. Created a recommendation API in Flask using machine learning-based clustering to personalize meal suggestions based on user preferences, dietary restrictions, and past interactions.

projects.heading: Financial Sentiment Analysis Research & Platform
projects.description: Co-authored a #research paper# exploring FinBERT applications for sentiment analysis in financial markets. Independently developed and deployed a web-based sentiment analysis tool now actively used by society members as a decision support system for investment decisions and market research.

projects.heading: Quantitative Equity Portfolio Management Project – Deutsche Bank Collaboration
projects.description: Invited by the Global Head of Quantitative Investment Solutions Research at Deutsche Bank to implement strategies from Chincarini & Kim's 'Quantitative Equity Portfolio Management'. Developed and back-tested two systematic portfolio models: a market-neutral strategy eliminating market risk while maximizing alpha, and a beta-neutral strategy with strategic factor tilts to enhance returns. Presented findings to Managing Directors and VPs in Deutsche Bank's Quant team.

projects.heading: Customising a client's data warehouse interface
projects.description: Used React and Django to create a custom #website# from scratch for our clients MakCorp in a small team.

Python: Started to learn Python in Year 6 through Code Club - this was my first exposure to programming other than Scratch
Created a variety of projects from stock price predictors and recommendation APIs to robotics control systems
Used professionally for machine learning research and scripting at Armalytix, and for automation tasks at Ashbury Global
Utilised in university group projects, such as building a full-stack tutoring platform and developing the backend of a client data warehouse, both using Django
Proficient with libraries such as pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, Django, and Flask
JavaScript: Used primarily for frontend development in both personal and professional projects, including my portfolio site and internship work at Valtech
Built dynamic, responsive UIs for web apps such as a meal planner and a client-facing data warehouse interface (see Projects section below)
Experienced with React for component-based development, state management, and integration with RESTful APIs
Comfortable using modern JavaScript (ES6+), handling asynchronous workflows, and manipulating the DOM
Java: Learnt during 'Programming Practices and Applications' module in my first year of university
Experience through university coursework and personal projects e.g. a visualisation tool for Coronavirus spread in London
C++: Learnt during 'Practical Experiences of Programming' module in my second year of university
Created a range of mini-projects during this module such as: a countdown solver, a string construction optimizer, and a puzzle solver for a Soduku-like game
Implemented quantitative trading strategies as a part of my work at King's Capital (a student investment fund)
Scala: Learnt during 'Practical Experiences of Programming' module in my second year of university
Created a range of mini-projects during this module such as: a compiler, a regular expression matcher, and an implementation of the board game 'Shogun'
React: This website is written in React!
Used React for developing frontend components when I was working at Valtech (I was on a team designing specifically designing front end components for Ocado Technologies)
Used for a range of personal and client projects (e.g. when creating a data warehouse interface for MakCorp and for my Meal Planner project)
Node: Backend development for Meal Planner project
Django: Created a full stack tutoring website and the backend for the data warehouse interface for MakCorp both using Django
HTML/CSS: Frontend web development skills used across multiple projects
TensorFlow: Used for machine learning projects including stock price prediction and transaction categorization at Armalytix

experience.name: Ashbury Global
experience.title: Data Administrator
points: Cleansed and validated client data for major retailers such as Aldi, Tesco, Waitrose, and Greggs, ensuring accuracy and readiness for migration to the company's new system.
Automated data validation using Python, improving efficiency by up to 12 times compared to the manual approach previously used by the team.

experience.name: Valtech
experience.title: Software Developer Intern
points: Collaborated in a team developing front-end components for Ocado Technologies.
Independently designed and implemented new features using React.js.
Critiqued and reviewed code solutions proposed by team members before deployment.
Designed tests using the Jest framework with TypeScript to guarantee code correctness and reliability.

experience.name: Armalytix
experience.title: Software Developer Work Experience
points: Conducted research and development into the use of machine learning algorithms with TensorFlow to categorize transactions in the company's database.
Automated API testing using Postman, enabling scalable and repeatable test suites for continuous integration.
Developed and automated end-to-end tests using Playwright in Python, reducing manual testing time.

education.name: Roundwood Park School
points: A-Levels: Maths (A*), Further Maths (A*), Computer Science (A), Physics (A)
Earned a distinction and a medal, placing in the top 200 nationally in the UKMT Junior Mathematics Olympiad (JMO) 2018
Awarded a distinction and ranked in the top 100 nationally in the UKMT Intermediate Mathematics Olympiad (Cayley) 2019, also earning a medal
